column4: How can I diagnose why my USB2.0 transfers reach only 5 MB/s?
same probem --
been having this problem since forever
I didn't have this problem with another distro seems unique to ubuntu
this makes me really sad, I really like using ubuntu. but my backups take forever and ever
yup why they run at 1:05 am every day....
what software are you using to backup?
simple bash script
no what programme, like rysnc maybe?
nope, just cp -a
yeah change that to rysnc
I have a simple script but its got a weird bug in it, but you can see the rsync...
I used rsnapshot, which in turn uses rsync, but performance is the same
okay -- only speedup I could think of
speeding up the backup is nice, but when I want to move something to the external HD it just takes forever, it's painful. it's the main issue right now
what kind of drive do you have?
WD MyBook
those are pretty good -- what fs are you using on your backup drive?
ext3, didn't want to risk ext4 at the time
yeah that should work - i have a seagate usb backup unit.
good lord, 21 minutes for a 6 gb file
have you seen this? http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=8124833&postcount=294
mounting the external drive manually with the 'async' option increased performance to 11 MB/s
